channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mark Cuban says he doesn’t do calls and prefers email because ‘if we do it by phone, I’m going to forget half the stuff that we talked about’
item.description: Meanwhile, Gen Zers prefer email or text because of their anxiety about talking on the phone.

item.title: CEOs say they are unplugging from the top job by cancelling all meetings and playing with Legos over the holidays
item.description: The leaders behind tech companies and multimillion-dollar cookie empires weigh in on work-life balance during the holidays—from strict screen time lim...

item.title: How to unlock the power of ChatGPT
item.description: This article is republished with permission from Wonder Tools , a newsletter that helps you discover the most useful sites and apps. I’ve recently wri...

item.title: New Year’s Day 2026: Are banks, grocery stores, and restaurants open?
item.description: When the confetti settles and the ball has dropped, many Americans will wake up on New Year’s Day — Thursday, Jan. 1, 2026 — with errands to run, groc...

item.title: 365 Inspiring, Poignant and Just Plain Great Quotes for 2026
item.description: For the 11th year in a row, this is the first thing I publish: one inspiring quote a day for the entire year.

item.title: Forget New Year’s resolutions: Psychology reveals how to rewire your brain for success in 2026

item.title: The leadership stories you cared most about in 2025

item.title: Feds are hunting teenage hacking groups like ‘Scattered Spider’ who have targeted $1 trillion worth of the Fortune 500 since 2022
item.description: Rogue teens have attacked some 120 companies—including Nike, Chick-fil-A, Instacart, and News Corporation—often posing as IT staff.

item.title: Want to Change Someone’s Behavior? Understand How the Brain Builds Habits, According to Neuroscience
item.description: Want to change your behavior? How about your consumers’ behavior? A new Georgetown study reveals how overlooked cues are the key.

item.title: How Managers Need to Adapt to Lead Blended AI-Human Teams
item.description: As AI agents take on more duties, they may be treated more like employees. This will bring challenges.

item.title: Why Kevin O’Leary Is Against New Stimulus Checks From the Government
item.description: His comments follow Trump’s claim that Americans will receive $2,000 payments.

item.title: Negative prices for electricity are getting more common in Europe and consumer costs have dipped—while Americans face rising energy bills
item.description: By September, the number of hours in Spain with negative prices had already topped 500 for the year to date, more than double the full-year total for ...

item.title: AI May Be Making Us All Dumber. Here’s What to Do About It
item.description: If you’re leaning a little too hard on generative AI to help you get through the workday, you may struggle in the long term.

item.title: It’s New Year’s Day 2026. What’s open and closed?
item.description: Most federal services are shuttered, but the retail landscape remains mixed.
